cipher(text, shift[, encrypt])

This fuction conducts Caesar cipher
src.cuyh3470_cipher.cipher(text, shift, encrypt=True)

This fuction conducts Caesar cipher Casser cipher is one of the simplest and mose widely known encryption techniques. Each letter is replaced by a letter some fixed number of positions down (encryptiont) or up (decription) the alphabet.

Parameters

  • text (sting) –

  • shift (int) –

  • encrypt (boolean value (default : True)) –

Returns

New text encrypted/decrypted

Return type

string

Examples

>>> text = "ababa."
>>> cipher(text = text, shift = 1, encrypt=True)
'bcbcb.'
